page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Within our area are at least two examples of depopulated villages: one is Ledall, to the north west of Waterperry, and the other is in fields the south of Thomley Hall Farm. Both may be the subjects of future archaeological work. Even during this century, the population pattern has altered. Local people remember going to a school on Waterperry Common before World War Two, as well as to the school in the village of Waterperry. Neither exists today. Part of the area contains what is reputed to be the smallest parish in England, that of Thomley. Currently, the "parishoners" are organising themselves to fight the prospect of the M40 extension cutting through the area.
